number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												I think I remember seeing this on kickstarter or something. Trying to revive the tactical shooter genre, comparing Takedown to classics like Rainbow Six and SWAT. This game doesn't even come close, though. I am so badly disappointed, I wish steam offered refunds, just so I could get my dollar back. It was on sale 80% off, $0.99, so I figured why not.The devs won't shut up about how tactical you have to be. How thoroughly you need to plan, how prepared you need to be, blah blah blah.The only "tactics" in this game seem to be:Peek around corners and shoot bad guys before they shoot you.Try to be sneaky and quiet.Fail at being sneaky and quiet because the bad guys apparently have the best hearing in the world, no matter how silent you think you're being.SWAT 4 was amazing. It came out in 2005, and it has more features and better gameplay than this pile of disappointment.It's pretty sad when a decade-old game is superior in every way.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												I bought this game when it was 1 dollar and got so far around 2 hours of playing time on it. That's well worth 1 dollar in my opinion. But 5 dollars? Not so much.Now, if you are looking at it for the full price, which is 5 dollars, you should take your money elsewhere. This game was kickstarted and I was looking forward to an actual tactical shooter as everyone else was. The team behind this game were a good set of developers who everyone believed could make a really good tactical shooter that could compare to games like SWAT 4 or the old Rainbow Six games.What you get instead is a game that seems about 80% finished, with solid shooting mechanics but shoddy texture work and poor AI. The AI sometimes hear you through two walls but sometimes don't notice you when you are next to them. Doesn't make any sense. The online community for this game doesn't exist as everyone has jumped ship on this game. So you're stuck with the AI teammates who just get killed constantly.For a dollar, if you are interested in a tactical shooter that you'll probably play for a couple of hours, go for it. But if you are looking for a tactical shooter for 5 dollars, look elsewhere. You're just wasting your money here.

content:

												I usually don't write reviews for games, especially if they're bad, but boy... Thankfully I got 2 copies for $1.50, so it's not that big of a loss. It provided me with a lot of laughs at just how bad this game is. It's like if Rainbow Six and Counter Strike were to have a child, this would be it. But the child would have such bad mental retardation that it would basically be a vegetable. To pu that into applicable terms, it has the "tactical" "gameplay" of Rainbow Six with the "style" of Counter Strike. They might have managed to emulate a visual style close to Counter Strike, but oh boy, they missed all of the functionality. How about the tactial gameplay of Rainbow Six? Nope. AI is too stupid when you're not shooting, and way too smart when you are. They run out into the open, or run away from you. Basically, this video sums it up just perfectly: 


YouTube™ Video:

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												Well. I hate to make this my first review, but I don't feel like looking at my Child Health, Safety, & Nutrition coursework for the week. Here we go.So, the good news: guns, bullets, and the overall concept.The bad news: how all those come together.I won't be the first or last to state that the AI is just awful. As mentioned in another review, the enemy soldiers can pick you off from across the map with one quick and silent shot through your cover, faster than you can say: "I wonder if people still play Ghost Recon?" Sometimes all of them converge on the player at one single time, and if it wasn't bad enough that one has an advantage over you (that's right, I said <<advantage>> because they're Aimbots), you'll have no hope against multiple foes because... the controls are pretty stiff. Very stiff. Fiddle and configure all you want. Go ahead, stick that 360 control in. It does not matter. Now, some of us are not surprised by a more confined feeling for a game like this... except, here, the controls wear a straight jacket. There's not much that's smooth about them. At all, really.Now, as others have also said, I really wanted to like this game. Truly. In its current state, it is <<not>> a finished game. It's not. It's ugly.Wait - speaking of ugly - have you seen the graphics on it? Now, okay, I get it, graphics are not the end-all. But it wouldn't hurt to have worked on the aesthetics as long as the gameplay, tactics, realism, and controls were all being ignored.Verdict: In its current state, this game is not worth playing or owning. If they do a gargantuan overhaul and addres all the issues we see... maybe we'll talk.'til then, dudes, turn this baby down.PS: Sorry, Mike, I gifted this to you so it wouldn't be in my "inventory."

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												Rainbow Six with ramped up difficulty and realistic gameplay. The game is so hard that the player is pushed into a position where they have to use their tactical prowess to survive. Guns basically insta-kill and there are pretty much no revives. The game, in its complete form, is an utter disaster. The maps are way too linear for tactical gameplay. I kept walking down stairs or into a room with a guy, and it would be who shot first rather than what strategy I used. The map design just doesn't help this mess, and that's only the beginning. Rainbow Six and other tactical shooters are fun because they don't sacrifice gameplay for realism. In Red Sabre, you can't get revived, and you don't respawn. If you die, you lose, and you are taken back to the lobby. In Hotline miami, you die a lot, but you respawn quickly and get as many chances as you want to complete the level. The same thing goes for Super Meat Boy. The truth is, Red Sabre needs a reason to be worth playing. The graphics are bland, the maps are linear and unexciting to say the least, and I don't feel compelled to completely restart the mission each time I fail at it. The developers clearly wanted a realistic feel, so that the players would be forced to play tactically. They did almost everything wrong with this game, and it isn't even close to being redeemed. The truth is, there are way better games on the market that do what this game does, but better. Honestly, I feel like this game tries to be unique among other shooters, but goes way over the top, and sacrifices any little bit of fun this game could've been capable of.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 30, 2014
												This was supposed to be the great hero that would bring back hardcore tactical co-op first person shooting to the old farts like myself, who have been waiting for a successor to games like Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six 3 and SWAT 4. It held great promise and the developer spoke such sweet words, pouring honey on the ears of the people like me. Then it was released...At first it seemed like a game with some launch hick-ups and bugs. The basis was there for T:RS to take this not-so-well sought after throne, but every update was just making more and more of a mess. Then, not very long after release, they started to sell it for 1€ and gave all owners an extra copy to give away to unsuspecting enemies friends... which is kind of a clear sign that they threw in the towel and gave up on it.As said; the basic foundation is there; a hardcore, slow paced, co-op, tactical game... if you can get into it. It's hard enough to get a group to successfully join a server, but then you can't make that server private. The AI seems okay at first, but is actually bugged out like crap in a thunderstorm. The game freezes, the game rolls over like a dog without anyone commanding, the game just doesn't do what it's suppose to and does everything it's not suppose to. The only thing that worked from the get go; the in-game text-to-speech chat, they had removed in an update. First the maps were all too big, so you were running around searching for the last terrorist... then they made them smaller, but made them minimal.Nothing has gone right with Takedown: Red Sabre, and my kind (the hardcore co-op FPS:ers) had to look elsewhere. Fortunately we found Insurgency, which is a bloody good game; get that one instead!The only thing T:RS managed to do was to have our gaming group make sarcastic jokes about "...it's in the hardcore nature of the game." and "...this game is epic!" which were compliments once upon a time, but after the release and subsequent downfall of T:RS have now become the worst insults we can say about a game.It's all just really sad...

												I think I remember seeing this on kickstarter or something. Trying to revive the tactical shooter genre, comparing Takedown to classics like Rainbow Six and SWAT. There is lag (i can run bf4) even in single player and there is constant stuterring. I can even occasionally shoot trough the edge of walls-The accuracy is awful for all guns except snipers and pistols. I understand that there is bullet drop and wind resistance, but i would take two shots in a row and sometimes, one bullet would go to the right while the other goes to the left. Makes no sense-Missions objectives are in the pause menu but you have no idea where your actually supposed to go. Concidering this is a simulator, you would think maybe you would have a blueprint. In one mission, a company hires you to go into their building to do some stuff, but does not give you a blueprint to locate the stuff. Do they want you to die?-when you are in lean mode and move, the game stutters -your weapon disappears when you touch a wall. I know this is on purpose but have no idea why. It is not part of a cover system and makes it easier to die when you try to hide behind a table only to learn you cant shoot.-squad system is not good at allPros:-okay, the game is not all bad. The the one-two hit kill is a nice feature for those looking for hard core games.-no respawn. True to the genre "simulator", once you die, your finished. If you are playing singleplayer, you can take the life of an ai teammate, but you only have three, and they can die on their own.-because you can die easily and lose 50 min of progress, it create a "one more game" feel as you are determined to beat that levelI will update as i play more.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
												This game reminds me of playing Far Cry 3 on the hardest difficulty: Be spotted and you're as good as dead. While the AI seem to be unable to notice bullets from a far distance, they react quickly enough if they see you and don't always instagib you, for example, if you are peeking around walls. The wall-peek system, while a good concept, is executed in such a way that you end up having to slowly peek around all of the walls, in order to shoot the guy waiting around the corner before he can see you. This game might be good multiplayer, but the single-player experience feels like trying to use a cheese grater to kill a SWAT team. It's possible, but it mostly relies on luck and the enemies messing up.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 17, 2013
												Do not buy this game. This is one of those games that metacritic will give a 32 for a good reason. The people who developed Take Down: Red Sabre probably had a good idea in mind, but executed it horribly. Take Down tries to bring realistic shooters to the modern day scene full of CoD and BF, but falls flat in a wide variety of aspects. First off, the gunplay is some of the worst I have had in a while. It consists of a poorly model weapon of choice with what seems like no recoil, but the spread on these guns is absolutely ridiculous after the first round. Second off, the AI is down right ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, including your enemies and squad mates. It seems that there is only two different poles to this AI, they will either be A) Seal Team Six grade soldiers or B) third graders that had their heads smashed in with hammers. The enemies also have something similar happening, they will either kill you instantly with one shot, no chance to kill them, or miss every single god damn round in thier mag. The AI enemies also have "unfair" tactics sometimes, most often involving them clipping through the ♥♥♥♥ing wall and blasting you and the remaining members of your squad striaght out of the game. The map design is also rather subpar in comparison to most games these days, consisting of almost exclusively CQC oriented environments, and mass enemy spawning. The worst part about all of this is that this is a game coming out in 2013 and very well could've been the spiritual successor to Tom Clancy's: Rainbow Six series, but takes that oppportunity and runs it into a 747 jet. A game with much potential, but with no delivery.3/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 12, 2014
												I didn't believe everyone's statements about how horrid, broken, and laughably poor this game was.Some even went as far as to say that for $1.50 US, it was far too high a price for the quality of the game.Well, some of that may be hyperbole, but the game certainly is fairly poor. It looks like there was a good vision behind it, but the execution of the vision was horrid on nearly every front.The engine has bugs galore (dropping to 1fps when I pressed F to reload? Sure, why not), the AI alternates between laser accuracy and Mister Magoo mode, your teammates have the intelligence of a warm cucumber, and the weapons all feel largely the same.Seriously, skip this game. It is as bad as they say, perhaps worse. However, if you're like me and can't resist trying a game to see if it really deserves the flak (as some certainly do not), give it a go.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 11, 2014
												I went into this game with  an open mind and hoped with patches it would be good. Turns out, i should have just not gotten it. Quick note: I think it is worth $1.50 while its on sale, but its not worth $15 and that what i am basing my review on.Cons:-You would think by now the patches would be ironed out, but no. There is lag (i can run bf4) even in single player and there is constant stuterring. I can even occasionally shoot trough the edge of walls-The accuracy is awful for all guns except snipers and pistols. I understand that there is bullet drop and wind resistance, but i would take two shots in a row and sometimes, one bullet would go to the right while the other goes to the left. Makes no sense-Missions objectives are in the pause menu but you have no idea where your actually supposed to go. Concidering this is a simulator, you would think maybe you would have a blueprint. In one mission, a company hires you to go into their building to do some stuff, but does not give you a blueprint to locate the stuff. Do they want you to die?-when you are in lean mode and move, the game stutters -your weapon disappears when you touch a wall. I know this is on purpose but have no idea why. It is not part of a cover system and makes it easier to die when you try to hide behind a table only to learn you cant shoot.-squad system is not good at allPros:-okay, the game is not all bad. The the one-two hit kill is a nice feature for those looking for hard core games.-no respawn. True to the genre "simulator", once you die, your finished. If you are playing singleplayer, you can take the life of an ai teammate, but you only have three, and they can die on their own.-because you can die easily and lose 50 min of progress, it create a "one more game" feel as you are determined to beat that levelI will update as i play more.

												My experience in this game so far: Pros:+ Tries to be like Rainbow Six+ Looks like an older generation Rainbow Six Game (Nostalgia?)Cons:- Looks like an older generation Rainbow Six Game- Enemy AI isn't really smart, but shoots fast and pretty acurate- Multiplayer lacks options like password protection, friends only, friendly fire off, kicking in game, banning in game, muting in gameMy experience for the multiplayer so far: I gave a friend of mine a Key, so we could play a bit of the co-op. No fun, no options, no recommendation

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 15, 2014
												For a game that prided itself on being the spiritual successor to the original Ghost Recon and Rainbow Six, this game is nothing like those games. It is an incomplete FPS game that had some really great ideas but executed them terribly. The movement is far too slow, feels clunky and only makes the game drag on. Weapon customization doesn't seem to do much, except for the situations where the bullets hit the environment and those moments seem to be very scarce in a game. Everyone dies from a single shot to anywhere on the person, which does not feel realistic at all since a shot to the arm would not immediately kill someone and also the fact that the main reason a person dies after being shot is more often than not blood loss, unless the person was shot in the head, which would lead to brain death. The customization menu does not function efficiently and it is a hassle to select every little option when you have to click left and right for each one and often times it is near impossible to know what certain options do for you and whether or not they are actually doing what they claim to do in game. Weapons are clunky and recoil doesn't feel real. Additionally, the controls feel weird, though I cannot explain why, and the tutorial does barely anything to help players understand how to use certain gameplay mechanics such as the breaching charges. The only thing that the tutorial said was that a certain door was meant to practice using breaching charges, but never indicated how or who can use them and honestly I still don't.I know I am being very picky, but I am a huge fan on realism in FPS games when it is promoted as such. For a game that had put so much effort into marketing its realism and tactical approach to the FPS game, I do not see anything different about this from other modern FPS games like CS and CoD other than some negative pointers, albeit the game does denote signs of its influences of the tactical FPS genre.In conclusion, this game had so many great ideas and the developers definitely were working towards making a good tactical FPS game that could be proudly considered a spiritual successor of Ghost Recon, Rainbow Six and even SWAT, but it falls short in every aspect and truly feels like an untested, unfinished mess. Since seeing Takedown: Red Sabre on Kickstarter I had high hopes for this game, but I can say that this game was extremely disappointing and was nothing like what I had expected at all.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 30, 2014
												As many reviewers have stated, the game is buggy and needs a lot of work. However, the game is playable(barely) IF you can work past those glitches.So, what is there beyond a buggy game? Visually the game is beautiful! Impressive textures, and lighting, and while the animation leaves much to be desired, everything else is rather good.The game labels it's self as a return to old school tactical shooters, which couldn't be farther from the truth. Yes, it's tactical in the sense that one hit will kill you, and you should be extra wary of your surroundings if you want to live, but does not even come close to the tactical FPS that it claims to be a return to.Overall, it's not an overly terrible game, and certainly has potential and is a pleasant bit of eyecandy, but just doesn't seem ready for release. By all means, if you see this on special for a really low price, pick it up! Otherwise stick to classic Rainbow Six game.Unfortunately at it's current price, and current state, I can't recommend it.4/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 1, 2014
												What the hell.. If you're going to make a Rainbow-Six clone, at least get the AI right.The enemy seems to know who and where you are at all times, despite being silenced.There's not a single millisecond of delay, they see something moving they're already firing. Makes me wonder how they could take over that building in the first place without shooting each others.If you're creeping up a corner, they already know you're there and are waiting guns drawn.This is not fun nor would I qualify this as "hard", it takes all the tactics away.I'm used to FPS and my reaction time is usually under 250ms, add the rotational speed and aiming I'd guess it's around 750ms and yet i'm too slow. By the time I click, i'm already dying.And note that the NPC shouldn't be aware of my presence while I knew very well where he was (thanks to metagaming)Even the worst of the Rainbow-Six games is better than this. The controls are horrible, even while wearing the lightest armor, you feel like a pile of bricks.The only good points I noticed are the choice between entrypoints, the time limit, the subsonic rounds,FMJ/JHP. Whoever made these, obviously knew about the basics of weaponry.I'm sure a lot of work and passion went into this game, problem is, the finished product is not great, not great at all.It claims to be a successor to Rainbow-Six games but doesn't even include the mechanics we loved so much. I can understand they can't produce as many items/weapons as Rainbow-Six did but they could at least build the mechanics just like it. For example, In Takedown, a silenced 1911 pistol and a regular 1911 pistol are two different weapons and cannot be both used in the same mission, while in Rainbow-Six, you could just take the silencer off at any time, or put it back on.Another example would be the weapon slots, you only have a primary weapon and a pistol. The "secondary weapons" should be named "Pistols" since its all it includes. In Rainbow-Six, you had a pistol, along with a primary weapon and a secondary weapon, depending on which Rainbow-Six we're talking about, you could use two LMGs or two snipers if you wanted to, the freedom was there. Now i'm not against having only two weapons, as it makes sense, we're not the army after all. I'm just against the lack of freedom when it comes to choosing your secondary weapon, they could easily let other small guns as a secondary weapon, such has MPs and smaller shotguns or just allow any weapons to be chosen in those slots, so you could have two pistols or a shotty and a sniper. You know, whatever strikes your fancy.Maybe it's just me, maybe it's the 15 mins spent in-game. I'll eventually play more, although I doubt I'll change my mind, this is not a game i'd recommend.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 16, 2014
												UPDATE 20.12.2014:I previously recommended this game because I thought it had some potential. I figured if more people strarted playing maybe the developers would try to fix it. I wanted to give this game a chance. Unfortunately it seems like the devs abandoned it. I do not reccomend buying it because you would be buying a broken game that will never be fixed.MY ORIGINAL REVIEW:After seeing all the negative reviews I decided to weigh in my own opinion.Sure, the game is still a bit rough around the edges, but it's fun to play on co-op.It has great potential and the developers are still working on updates and new content.If you are a tactical shooter fan you should support the developers instead of hatingon the game and just saying "SWAT 4/Rainbow Six 3 are better". Of course these are greatgames, but they have been around for 9 and 11 years respectively. Are you going to justkeep playing them for the next decade and discard everything else, because it's not as good?Or would you rather try and support the people that want to bring back the experience?If 14€/$15 is too steep just add the game to your wishlist and wait for a sale.There's no rush and it's easy to snag it for a fraction of the price. You evenget an extra copy so you can gift it to a friend and play together. Better yet,I'm sure all the people who hate the game so much they say "it gave them cancer"will be more than happy to trade their extra copy or give it to you for free.Try reaching out to them.If all disappointed "true tactical shooter fans" tried to give constructive criticism,participate in the community and support the developer, we might eventually get the realRainbow Six and SWAT successor. The potential is there, it just needs more polish.TL;DR: This game is underrated. It has the potential, but we need to support thedevelopers instead of hating to make it work.Also, wait for a sale and buy it dirt cheap.Or trade for it since so many people have extra copies.PROS:- the weapons feel good and behave realistically- the maps are great- there is a lot of gear/equipment to choose- the graphics are good but still run decently on older computersCONS:- the AI: enemies are unpredictable and teammates are unreliable- there is no action planning- you can only give very basic orders to your teammatesPRO TIP: There is a very useful map guide from 505 Games on the Takedown community hub.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												OK, where to begin with this one?The return of the tactical shooter sounds like a great idea, right? Remember the old Rainbow Six games? They weren't just a typical run and gun kind of game. You had to think, you had to plan every move, and plan it well. It's clear that Takedown: Red Sabre tried to emulate those glory days, but unfortunately, it has fallen flat on its face.Let's start with the way the game handles. Characters move at a snail pace, I understand that this is supposed to be a tactical shooter, but that doesn't mean you have to move 3 inches a second. Crouching barely makes a difference save for allowing partners to shoot over you, and while there is a lean function, when aiming with certain weapons this can cause the scope to go off centre, and will cause you to miss the shot entirely.The AI can range from superhuman to completely braindead. I can't count how many times enemies have been able to see me through solid walls and kill me. I have also lost count of how many times the enemy has simply stood there and stared in the other direction, even when shooting with an unsurpressed weapon. I would strongly recommend not playing the single player, because if you die, the partner AI will stand there and most likely get shot one by one without doing anything.The weapons have very little diversity in them. Sure, there is a selection available, but most of them are different variotions of the same damn gun (The side arms are the biggest culprit of this). The weapons themselves don't feel good to handle. Every automatic rifle seems to kick way more than it should.The levels are incredibly complex, which wouldn't be so bad if it weren't for the fact that the game doesn't have a map, so you have no idea where you are. The game doesn't tell you the objectives during the mission either, so you'll spend most of the time wandering around aimlessly trying to figure out what you're supposed to be doing.There are a number of other issues that the game suffers from. Servers don't work half the time, animations are jittery, the game looks bad even on high, and looks atrocious on low, even th sound that plays when the gun fires just stops sometimes for no reason. Everything about this game just screams unfinished. You can actually find proof of just how unfinished it is by looking in the steam directory for the game.I am lucky (or rather, unlucky) in the fact that I didn't actually spend anything on this game, as it was gifted to me. I simply cannot recommend this game in it's current state to anyone, it is simply not up to the standard that we were hoping for in a game like this. I am hoping that this will all eventually be resolved, but it seems less and less likely that it will, so for now this game isn't worth your time. Steer clear of this one guys.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 6, 2014
												There are times when your first impression gives you a false perspective on a game, then you go back and play it and realize that the game is not that bad. My version of that is EVE Online. There are also games which you, the player, fail to see why people hate the game so much. For me, Orion: Dino Horde is a great example. Takedown: Red Sabre is neither of those examples. and wasn't worth the 99 cents I paid this past Summer Sale. From what I assume, this game is trying to be a cross between Counter-Strike and Rainbow Six, but fails at both. The weapons don't feel anywhere near as powerful and fun to use as Counter-Strike and the teammate AI is so bad that it feels more like a series of cheap deaths rather than a tactical experience.  I've had two of my squadmates in single player killed by a guy who seemingly appeared out of nowhere behind me and there was no indication that there was someone behind me. No voice clips, no gunfire from my AI teammates who were just standing around scratching their asses rather than checking in the directions that I couldn't face, nothing. The enemy AI is utterly cheap and the teammate AI rarely does anything to help you and more likely than not follows you around like a lost child looking for its parents.The online community is dead and for good reason. The control is extremely sluggish and I don't feel like can be stealthy and tactical when I can only walk from room to room rather than running from cover to cover. As stated before, the guns feel weak and the whole pace of the game is extremely off. I initally wanted to play the game long enough to get the trading cards and sell them to make a little return on investment but the game is so bad that I can't even play the game for that long. Avoid at all costs, not worth 99 cents in a sale and the current asking price of 4.99 is almost criminal.

												Think of COD: Modern Warfare [any], in a S.W.A.T. setting, only a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ nightmare.If they had spent more time on gameplay and gameplay mechanics, it would have turned out a lot better. Lemme list a few things:1: You always spawn in the same spot. This wouldn't be an issue, except for the following:1A: The AI knows exactly where you are at any given time. It might give you a second to two to react, is about all the concession you'll get there.1B: There are a limited number of map navigation choices from your spawn point, without getting shot, due to the above.2: The movement mechanics are reminiscent of CounterStrike. Only, not in a good way. It's like putting CounterStrike in Tar, and trying to move. Combined with the above, will leave you dead quite often.3: Grenades are more of a distraction and danger to the player, than the AI, due to the above.There were several other things that should have either been fixed, or not implemented at all, which slip my mind.Not something i intend to go back and play again. I'd rather get on S.W.A.T. 4 or CoD [much as i hate it].

												The game is very clunky and I feel like I have to fight the controles every step of the way, it is not smooth what so ever. I give it a 3/10 just because it has the right idea, the pieces were all there but they haven't figured how to put them together just yet.

content:
Posted: February 21, 2014
												My experience in this game so far: Pros:+ Tries to be like Rainbow Six+ Looks like an older generation Rainbow Six Game (Nostalgia?)Cons:- Looks like an older generation Rainbow Six Game- Enemy AI isn't really smart, but shoots fast and pretty acurate- Multiplayer lacks options like password protection, friends only, friendly fire off, kicking in game, banning in game, muting in gameMy experience for the multiplayer so far: I gave a friend of mine a Key, so we could play a bit of the co-op. The first round went well enough - only that I started to hear a russian kid talking to his family. (Probably should have done his dishes, but failed to do so - I really couldn't understand) The next round, said russian kid starts to shoot us (Teammates) in the head - procedes to talk gibberish. Probably insulted our upbringing, or our parents. Maybe he asked us, if we could do his dishes. I really couldn't understand.I tried to kick him, or remove him from the game - put to no avail. We restarted the server. Now more than just that russian kid joined, but some rather heavily mentally ill as well. We started off to a round of teamkill-gallore and I threw the game into a corner. No fun, no options, no recommendation

content:
Posted: February 22, 2014
												This game has 2 major faults.1. Its supposed to be a one shot one hit foe everything, You, the enemeies, equipment, etc, well thats partially true. You can shoot whatever ya want BUT its almost IMPOSSIBLE to KILL anything but yourself. You can die in one hit but anything else? forget about it.2. Everything is smarter than you. Its supposed to be stealth playable but its like EVERYTHING KNOWS YOURE THERE. You cannot play it stealithly because it wont let you, and thats the kind of game its supposed to be. Everything practically has super sensitive trigger plates and you take one step and it knows youre there.it was discounted to $1.24 but with these faults its not even worth that. This game can be used as an insult for Christ sakes.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 26, 2014
												If the midnight TV ads for Dr. Ho's electrocution equipment was the king of false-advertisement then TakeDown is the counter-part. With clunky mechanics, terrorists as dull as a man named Chester and features equivelant to a Romanian jail it's worth to take note that compared to the jail it costs to play this game. The sound is dreary and levels are as interesting as motel drapes. Not to mention that the majority of levels feel like re-hash from the developer's previous works, take for example "Radar Storm" which seems oddly familiar to a particular level in "Rainbow Six: Rogue Spear". The main menu is non-linear as Duke Nukem Forever and as 'feature-rich' as a 1920s telegraph pole. Especially the annoyance of repeated main menu booting-before you do absolutately anything else after anything else that you've done. I'd rather spend a day with Paulie Shore and Piers Morgan on a tugboat while we keep running out of canola to propel the behemoth. The weapons are lackluster at best, frankly if this game would've been converted as a paintball or NERF style action, it would've gotten more customers.Although that may not be true, the truth of the matter is; Hard-Core, tactical gamers are eager and ready. Ready for "THE" next one in this genre. Not a revolutionary new engine, cinematic storyline. Up to date technology and the correct formula as the past. Most of all put some love into the damn thing and not rush for revenue. Would I recommend this game? No.I'd recommend going to a home-basing party with MacCauley Culkin.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 30, 2014
												As many reviewers have stated, the game is buggy and needs a lot of work. However, the game is playable(barely) IF you can work past those glitches.So, what is there beyond a buggy game? Visually the game is beautiful! Impressive textures, and lighting, and while the animation leaves much to be desired, everything else is rather good.The game labels it's self as a return to old school tactical shooters, which couldn't be farther from the truth. Yes, it's tactical in the sense that one hit will kill you, and you should be extra wary of your surroundings if you want to live, but does not even come close to the tactical FPS that it claims to be a return to.Overall, it's not an overly terrible game, and certainly has potential and is a pleasant bit of eyecandy, but just doesn't seem ready for release. By all means, if you see this on special for a really low price, pick it up! Otherwise stick to classic Rainbow Six game.Unfortunately at it's current price, and current state, I can't recommend it.4/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 5, 2014
												This game is not currently at a level in which it is fun, other than as a troll.Those are the only people you will find playing with you. There is no "Friendly Fire off" nor any auto team kick for team killers. Nor is there a votekick option.This combination means that instantly everyone tries to kill each other on a team, unless they know each other.For a game about team work, this oversight instantly breaks any ability of the game to function within its own parameters.For gunplay, it's clunky, has odd choices in controls (Auto-stick leaning is not a common choice for people), and the bots will generally kill you instantly.The lack of quick movement, a cover system, or any cool gadgets such as SWAT 4 provided, means you just walk around a corner and flip a coin to see if you get shot instantly or not. So by yourself or with others, this game is not complete nor fun. I would rate it a decent student submission, and little more.

content:
Posted: February 22, 2014
												My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 24, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

content:
Posted: February 12, 2014
												Bleh. It's not too terrible, but it's not ultimately good either. Nontheless, thanks to my pal RedAlpha for gifting me this game, since it's the thought that counts. Anyway, the graphics are decent and the controls are acceptable, but the AI is clunky and ruins the gameplay in Singleplayer. Gameplay in general is underwhelming and the game overall is a pretty good idea or promise versus a poor execution. Another problem I have is with the loadouts, even if you make and save changes to the weapons of each of the loadouts, the game doesn't acknowledge it, unless I'm doing something incorrectly. Maybe some multiplayer might change this review, but until then this game is pretty well below average in rating for good concept and premise, pretty good controls and appreciatable graphics, but the framerate/game overall is too laggy, the AI is unrealistic and pretty dull, gameplay is underwhelming especially with the lack of excitement-inducing things like music, and the illusion of the ability to customize one's set of gear. Multiplayer is unchecked, however.3/10 - Not terrible, but not too good either. Could use a handful of improvement/work. (Yeah, to say the least.)

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 24, 2014
												Not sure what to really say about this game. For one, it's one of those half♥♥♥♥♥♥♥mediocre game titles, where little no effort was put into it. At the same time, it's one of those games that drain the life out of you while you play. (Another notable game like this is Day One: Garry's Incident...) Naturally, this game should have been funny; with all it's flaws and such, but it's not. It just feels sad and poor: like watching a homeless guy getting robbed of his shopping cart; and then getting beat up by the robber, who is using the homeless guy's shopping cart to beat him up. It's just a poor gaming experience overall.To begin this mess, we have the tutorial: a simple game mode that should detail the game's mechanics, simple enough. The first thing you'll ever notice, is just how sub-par the graphics are. Almost looking like an Xbox 360 kinda game graphics. (A quick glance at the graphics settings beforehand yield none. (This game has no graphics settings.)) Anyway, as I progress thru this game, the second thing worth noting are the sluggish movement/controls. (Now, it's quite common for a tactical FPS to have this type of feel, but this in no way helps this game.) The commands were easy enough, so I continued with the tutorial. Not expecting much from this, I ended up encountering a bug: at the section where it tells me to "throw a grenade," nothing happens. I charge up the throw meter, and nothing, Can't throw the grenade, can't switch to my other weapons, absolutely nothing. Luckily, I could skip this section by opening the door to the next section. (Funny thing is, after opening this door, all the controls self-corrected. Everything was back to normal.) Anyway, tutorial ends with a shooting range, nothing special. (Although, a glitch occured were I clearly had an AK, but the weapon icon showed a typical M4 Rifle.?) Now on to the main event!The actual game is atrocious! As soon as you start an actual level, you are thrown into the mission, (with your buddies,) to complete the objectives. But no matter how hard I tried, no matter how much effort I put into this game; I was unable to complete one objective.The enemy AI are like super bots. They already know where you are. As soon as you alert them; they seek you, and they will find you! They also have aimbot, so trying to get away from their shots is almost impossible. They kill you and your team faster than you can say; "Hocus pocus boppity boo!" In fact, you stand a better chance without your teammates. Only problem is: you die in two or three hits. What a joke. Makes playing this game a pain. And the whole game is like that too. Absolutely atrocious!As for the multiplayer, there was no one playing. So I quit, and uninstalled this sorry♥♥♥♥♥excuse of a video game.If I were anybody, I wouldn't spend a single dime on this heap♥♥♥♥♥♥of a game. Only if you got it for free, then it actually might be worth a laugh. Other than that, don't bother with this.As a side note: While playing this game, I later found out that I had three instances of the game running. That's right! Three different windows of the same game! That's the first time I've seen a game on Steam do that.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 16, 2014
												Has call of duty not got you feeling the same way as it used to; How about battlefield? Well good luck to you! Because here comes Takedown: Red Sabre! An amazing MMORPG FPS Indie platform adventure game for all ages! This game comes chock full of five, yes five full maps! Thats four more then Dota 2 has to offer. Also included is a heart touching story mode that will grip you from the very start. Just when you thought that was all there is multiplayer! Play with friends or with internet people, Use their in game chat to send out your orders! All in all this game is worth way more then the asking price of $1.49 USD. Please pick up this game while the deal last!

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 14, 2014
												I like this game.This game is very challenging, the AI is really difficult to defeat.Maybe that is the reason why a lot of people don't like this game.If this game is too difficult for you, you can give your opinion instead of claiming that this is a bad game because the AI kicked your♥♥♥♥♥..You have to play this game slowly and be carefull.This game is more hardcore than the Rainbow Six Vegas series or Rainbow Six Lockdown.Some people complain about the the reload animations.In real life you can press on a m4/m16 based weapon bolt catch with your thumb, while others hit it with their hand.In this game it's hit with the hand, nothing wrong with that animation.Some things to improve:A big issue for me is the lack of advanced video options for the moment.This was already announced to be changed soon.Also a grenade crosshair would be nice.Sometimes the AI is not really smart and their skill seems inconsistent.Sometimes they kill you very quickly, other times they don't even hit you or see you.I like to play the "Tango hunt" mode of this game and the coop is also cool, if you play with experienced players.If you don't want an arcade shooter, but a more difficult game than this is for you!The price of this game was also very good, i got it for 1,39 and got a free gift copy with it.I bought this game again with the assumption to get another gift copy, but then i got just 1 copy of the game... that's not cool.

												I highly recommend this game for play with friends. It's very fun, and, yes, you die a lot, but how fun is it to just get shot in the face a bunch of times, and heal in a few seconds? This game is not well-developed, but its worth the price (or at least the price during sales). You die a lot, you can kill friends just as quickly as enemies kill you, it's a ton of fun. A lot of people say things like "bad AI" but really they're saying "I can't win" or "I'm not skilled enough." When you play this game, you either get good or die. But in most cases both. Ok, majority cases both.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 9, 2014
												This game is not that bad if you like slow paced gameplay, but really need improvements on everything.While playing, it just felt like a very basic close quarter version of Arma gameplay which is a good thing and what I was expecting from this type of game. If curious, you should buy it when it is on sale. I don't recommend paying the full price if you don't like slow paced tactical gameplay.My little review and complaints are based on singleplayer missions and overall game mechanics because multiplayer is somewhat "dead" right now, I can't find decent pings on my region.The game feels like a "beta". Glass reflection is odd, the movement need to be more responsive and less awkward, AI reaction is fine but how it detects sound is sometimes unfair, AI hearing your shoots are ok, but hearing when you walk slowly or open doors is just strange, why opening doors are so noisy? Why no AI footsteps sounds? And their sound cues/chatting are so odd. If they can hear me why can't I hear them? And the AI should move more, not just stand in some corner waiting but don't make it charge like a suicidal retard. I really desire that in the future this game gets improved. I will recommend this game because I did enjoyed playing, but like I said, it feels like a beta, unpolished do be more precise.

Posted: May 5, 2014
												Like many others, I was really happy to see this game on kickstarter and the ideology seemed great, being a spiritual follower of swat and rainbow six games, with a solid team behind it. But also, like many others... I was VERY disappointed in the "final" product. -What more can I add after reading some of the reviews.. There really are no redeeming qualities, its disappointing in every field, and lacks many, many features already featured in tactical games published 10 years ago! I don't know if a low budget is to blame, or the lack of interest in gamers when the product was financed, but this game is still months of work and a ton of money away from being even nearly complete. Too bad no one is playing it anymore to keep up an incentive to update and patch it...tl,dr: dont buy this game

content:
Posted: February 12, 2014
												Bleh. It's not too terrible, but it's not ultimately good either. Nontheless, thanks to my pal RedAlpha for gifting me this game, since it's the thought that counts. Anyway, the graphics are decent and the controls are acceptable, but the AI is clunky and ruins the gameplay in Singleplayer. Gameplay in general is underwhelming and the game overall is a pretty good idea or promise versus a poor execution. Another problem I have is with the loadouts, even if you make and save changes to the weapons of each of the loadouts, the game doesn't acknowledge it, unless I'm doing something incorrectly. Maybe some multiplayer might change this review, but until then this game is pretty well below average in rating for good concept and premise, pretty good controls and appreciatable graphics, but the framerate/game overall is too laggy, the AI is unrealistic and pretty dull, gameplay is underwhelming especially with the lack of excitement-inducing things like music, and the illusion of the ability to customize one's set of gear. Multiplayer is unchecked, however.3/10 - Not terrible, but not too good either. Could use a handful of improvement/work. (Yeah, to say the least.)

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 22, 2014
												STOP, DO NOT BUY THIS GAME, BEWARE.Takedown: Red Sabre was the single bigest dissapointment of the past 2 years for me. As a huge fan of games like Swat, Rainbow Six, and Counter Strike I was looking forward to this the moment I saw it. A revival of the Tactical Shooter genre? Oh wow, count me in! With devs who worked on Tom Clancy games and freaking HALO?! WHAT! Count me in, this has GOT to be good...right?Boy were we suckered. Promises of being the revival of a long dead genre turned into not just a bad game, but beyond that. This is simply one of the worst products I have ever bought, and it pains me to say that. On release it was a buggy mess with features not working left and right. What we saw in demo's and videos couldn't possibly be the same thing as this released final game, but it was.Controls are clunky. The AI is terrible. The guns shoot and feel even worse. The maps are nice but that's all irrelevant when the mechanics of the game are awful. Steamcharts says the game has an average of 16 people online at peak times in the past 30 days, with an all time peak of 1,071 on release, which was only September 20, 2013, about 2 months exactly ago. The game is already dead. I seriously felt suckered and swindled out of $15, prying on peoples hope for a revival of the genre. This game was such a disaster and as a result of it, I will never blindly give money to people (kickstarter), or pre-order a game again. Instead of this, spend $10 for Rainbow Six 3 Gold, and use the extra $5 to go buy a cheeseburger[Edit, and of my 3 hours played, probably about 2 and a half of those hours were trying to get the game to work period.]

												Do not get this game, while I admit I am slightly biased towards shooters, I am a fan of tactical FPS and Third Person Shooters. This game brings neither element to the table and in fact is a glaringly terrible game. But enough of my hatred, let the actual review get underway shall we?Pros:some variety (although rather meager) in loadout options.Attention to detail on the weapons is notable.AI does seem rather sharp.Cons:The weapons just feel wrong in this, they feel closer to capguns with overexaggerated recoilSound FX are just...noWhile I did list it as a pro, the loadout section just doesn't feel like theres ENOUGH variety.I understand that JHP rounds are designed for soft targets but even a good bulletproof vest isn't going to stop 18 of them. Conclusion: Don't bother with this game. I would say go pick up a copy of Rainbow Six: Vegas 2.

Product received for free
												Possibly the worst "tactical" shooter game to have ever shown it's diseased corpse to the public. content:
Posted: February 8, 2014
												It was as cheap as poo in a brown paper bag, set aflame by the hatred of lost time and money. Its essence hanging in the air, giving off a stench so strong and thick. So nothing that commends this game can be seen or heard. The very thought of positive feedback drown out by loss and sorrow.  At the very least, I commend this game for being the first to ever draw me in with it's sale price only to have the community feedback destroy every ounce of optimism (of the very few) I had long before the game even began.Being that as it may,  it was someone's project at some time or another. That said, one must realize that it is a game an art. Weather it'd be good or bad it still has my respect. Someone accomplished a dream with this game, in the end only to have it burn. But make no mistake: it made me feel good for not having many dreams, and for that I am truly greatful.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 20, 2014
												Where do i begin with writing this review. Well for starters i wanna point a few aspects out. For one, the developer is extremely small and yet very active on the steam forums, which is a huge plus. Keeping in touch with the fanbase and owners of the game to help improve Takedown is a great way to get this game in the state its suppose to be in. With that said, this game is far from complete, along with huge improvements that need to be made in order for this game to stand up among the great Tactical shooters on the market. Even though this game has huge flaws and gaming breaking problems. Takedown has a feature ahead of itself to be a rather extremely good game. After numorious updates over the course of 5 months, the game is starting to head in that direction but the key aspect that has to be addressed is the A.I. Thanks to some forum members, it seems to be getting into that direction as we speak due to the community tweaking up the A.I file. I have tested this out myself and i have to say I'm rather impressed. Sure you will still get one shotted a lot of the time but the A.I react different this time around. It's not an instint kill when they see you right away. It feels as if now when they first see you, they don't react to you right away unless they have encountered you before hand. Which to me gives a new level of play. Makes me think more harder and how i wanna approach the enemy. Yet even with those changes, the A.I still has its problems but with future updates, I'm sure that will change. Can't wait for that update to come out down the road. I have not gotten a chance to try out the Multiplayer yet due to having a few crashes mess up my time with that mode. However it only happens ever so offten for me. With the state that the game is in at the moment, its a step in the right direction but it still has a big up hill battle it has to face in order to stand up to genre its trying to be. I don't regret getting this game as gift cause I know the dedicated fans behind this game wil help improve this game dramaticly. After all this game is suppose to be community driven so let's make it happen. For those of you out there who really like the idea and want this game to be what it stands for. Show your support and get your concerns and opinions out there. The devs are very active, let your voice be heard and get this game fixed for the better, cause honestly it deserves it.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 6, 2014
												An amazing cluster♥♥♥♥ of bugs and failures. It was released obviously incomplete and featured amusing bugs such as during a match not being able to move to the left or right at all so best plan around being unable to move properly.  The sound design is abysmal with there being very little drop off of sound for voices so the volume of an enemy AI speaking sounds about as loud if he's on the other side of a door as if he's around a corner down a long hallway.  A lack of a map before deploying leads to becoming very lost on anything but the Training room map and leads to just blindly guessing to find if you are going to the objectives. There are rather arbitrary time limits for the scenario mode with no real rhyme or reason why you're limited to 30 minutes.  AI allies are stupid at best and at worst just sit where they spawn and twiddle their thumbs acting only as extra lives for the player.

content:
Posted: March 16, 2014
												When I played ArmA for the first time, I thought the AI was bad. Then I played this game.The AI has perfect aim, it never misses. It also tracks your movement through walls, so peeking a corner will result in certain death. And since there is not much movement sounds and the AI is silent most of the time, you get continuously jump-scared. NPCs also like to spawn wherever they like, so getting shot at start of a round is not an impossibility. All of this makes the game quite hard.(I actually tried to complete one level with my friend, but after 1h of playing we gave up.)Movement is very slow, even when sprinting. Audio is really bad, there is no music (except the 40 sec loop on main manu), voice acting is really awkward as are all poses and animations in the game.And fall damage is insane. Falling more than 50cm will kill you.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
												This game has alot of bad reviews and for good reason. The game is terrible to play alone, its not a modern run and gun game and the AI feels godlike at times. Prepare to want to put your fist through your monitor if you want to invest any time into learning this game.With that said, this game is alot of fun to play with a dedicated 4 man group and very challenging. Once you get the hang of the game and understand how to play around the strengths and weaknesses of the enemy AI the game becomes extremely fun and challenging. The levels are extremely hard, bordering on unbeatable unless you really know what you're doing and are in a very serious tactical mindset. But boy oh boy does it feel rewarding to complete a mission with no casualties in a 4 man group.Pros:-Very difficult-Meant for 4 player Co-op-Tactical shooter, not a run and gun game-Intense teamwork and communication requiredCons:-420 no scope AI-Deaths can feel extremely frustrating-Maps can get stale after you learn them all-Not for casual FPS players

content:
Posted: July 2, 2014
												This game is an abomination, the AI is quite possibly the least consistant in any game to date. Sometimes they'll just look at you, not moving an inch, other times, they'll instantly kill you the SECOND you think about opening a door. Sometimes you'll breach a door and three guys will just look at you, other times they will wipe your whole squad instantly. The game is hilariously unfinished, it's pretty damn bad, but at $.50 or whatever I paid for this and copies for my friends, it's worth it. It's absolutely hilarious.If you're a hardcore shooter fan looking for the next Rainbow Six, don't buy it.If you're a casual shooter fan looking for a new game, don't buy it.If you're just wanting to buy a game to play with your friends for a one night session of laughs at programming, I fully endorse this purchase. This is the epitome of dice rolling in shooter games. The AI will either crush you, or you will crush it. Good luck.

content:
Posted: January 29, 2016
												Takedown Red Sabre trys to be a tactical shooter. It wants to be like the old Rainbow Six / Ghost Recon games but did it reach its goal? To make it short: ♥♥♥♥ING NO!Negative PointsBugs- This game has no bugs, it is a bug! (and I dont talk about insects..). Seriously this game is so broken!- Random game crashes are common, random frame drops are very common and you have to restart the game to fix this.- Bugs like glitching through objects, animation bugs or bugs when you switch the weapon are so common that you think that they are "features".AI- Ore collectors from C&C Red Alert are real brainiacs compared to the AI from this game.- Player detection seems to be totally random. Sometimes the AI see you behind the doors/walls or detect you from all over the map and sometimes they just ignore you even when you stand directly in front of them. - AI uses aimbot and wallhack. This is so much fun.. not!- Team mates are totally ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and dont react to orders.Graphics- Not the worst but far away from good.Multiplayer- Connection problems, lag, no fun!- Totally dead by now.Gameplay- The game react so slow to your keyboard input (or sometimes it just ignores it)- You die so fast and you cant heal yourself.. no fun especially with the hacking AI!- Hit detection, shooting, walking - everything feels so wrong.- There is no "tactical gameplay". You can just hide, lean around a corner and pray that the aimbot AI dont instantly kills you.Sound- Cheap- Character voice lines often switch between german and english..Miscellaneous- Most weapons, most attachments and all body armor beside heavy armor are completely useless.- The menu sucks, configuring your loadout is a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥- You cant jump.- Fall damage is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t!- Time limit from 60 minutes.. lelNeutral PointsGerman translation- Not sure if I should cry or laugh about the horrible german translation.. they should have used google translator for a better translation.Maps- The design of the most maps is ok, you got different ways and different spawnpoints also different map themes.- Not many maps.Positive PointsNoneConclusionThe game had potential but the execution was done sooo badly. The game is unfinished and broken all the way. Save your time & money cause this game is part of the category "failed early access games".

												No. Just no. Bugs, the inability to command your squad, missing sound effects. This is just a really unfinished product that was shipped out too early. While touted as "tactical", the inability to command your squad reduces their function to just additional lives in single player. The AI, both friendly and enemy, is just god awful, with your men not reacting to an enemy literally meters away.Conclusion:It's $4.99 for a reason. Hell, it's not even worth that much. content:
Posted: November 27, 2013
												I truly don't believe this game is as terrible as everyone says it is. However, it isn't a very good game either. If you are a fan of the old Rainbow Six games (anything before Lockdown), then you will find enjoyment for a maximum of a few hours. The game tries to be a successor to Rainbow Six, but there is no reason to buy this game over RS3 on Steam, besides slightly better visuals. I enjoyed playing each level online with a friend, but there is not as much replay value as Rainbow Six games. The AI is botchy and unintelligent, which is especially frustrating when you are trying to command a team. What I am basically getting at is that it is just a mediocre version of the Rainbow Six games that introduces nothing new (no story, no characters, no interesting objectives, etc.).

content:
Posted: October 10, 2013
												NOT RECOMMENDED AT ALLThis game can be resumed perfectly by these quotes from reviewers (to name a few):GameSpot: "An unfinished, broken mess of a tactical shooter that offers not even one redemptive bright spot."NowGamer: "Whether a future patch will rectify a lot of problems with Takedown: Red Sabre or not is irrelevant; Serellan should not have released a game this unfinished in the first place. The core of the game could be good, but not until a number of issues have been resolved."jparker782 at MetaCritic: "This is a terrible, unfinished mess. This game will go down in history as one of the worst crowd-funded indie games ever. It is the Atari E.T. of indie games. Many were following this game's development for over a year. The developer has released an alpha product and is selling it as a finished game. It most certainly is not. AVOID THIS GAME."Jimbo364 at MetaCritic: "I thought this game looked pretty dry from the previews I've seen. It didn't seem like their was much to the game at all. Seemed like a bland version of SWAT/Rainbow 6 games. When the game came out, it confirmed what I was thinking, but it was much much worse than I ever believed.First problem I had was options. Graphic options are pathetic with only v-sync, overall quality, brightness, and resolution. No way to tweak specific elements. In-game you can not access the options menu at all. You can not change graphics, controls, sound, etc. AT ALL in-game.Another problem I had was the gameplay. Controls work for the most part, but the movement felt stiff. Sometimes the game will glitch your gun when you switch and leave you stuck unarmed. AI is spotty at best. Teammates can not being commanded to move anywhere, they only follow like sheep and get in the way. They rarely get any enemies. Enemy AI is mediocre, they don't react to your unsuppressed gunfire all the time and won't shoot you even you stand right in front of them sometimes. Also the timer is obnoxiously in the middle of the screen, something that can just be on the corner of the screen.Multiplayer flat out didn't work at all. Insulting to anyone that wanted to play with others.The overall presentation and gameplay of the game is generic to put it mildly. Should of just called this game Tactical Shooter, because it does nothing to stand out from the crowd despite being much newer than similar games. If your going to revive a genre, take what was good about it and refine was not so good about it. There is no heart to this game, it's a cold and lifeless."OVERALL:An unfinished piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥that never should have released at this state. The game is utterly broken and your A.I. mates aren't even working and helping you properly. The early Rainbox Six and SWAT games are a milion times better than this wannabe tactical shooter. Ignore this game's existence and do not support developers that screws over their customers. This is the dark side of crowfunding gone wrong!BOTTOM LINE:Stick with games that work and that are fun... like any Rainbow Six and SWAT games! And honestly, I wonder if "The WarZ" is worst than this Red Sabre...RATING:0.0 / 10If only another SWAT game would come out someday... there is at least a new Rainbow Six: Patriot coming eventually...

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 28, 2016
												Okay, so this game is hard. It's hard as hell. But it's also the most tactical shooter out there and I'll tell you what, those who state otherwise clearly have never experienced actual situations like this.Now I don't claim to be a soldier or Spec Ops guy, I'm really not, but I am an experienced Airsofter who specialises in CQB and has trained with a PMC on a number of occasions to get better at building clearing and this game exactly replicates that experience. You got spotted by one guy for a split second? You bet your♥♥♥♥♥he shouted something and it chained all the way through the building so everyone heard it. Doorways are murderous, exactly as with airsoft and real life (They're called death funnels for a reason guys), and the fact that you die almost instantly and have very little ammo is exactly as it should be. Here's the thing: none of us gamers are trained soldiers. We like to think we are because we play stuff like Ghost Recon or Battlefield or even Arma, but we aren't and people claiming that this game is so unrealistic should really try going Urban Airsofting and see what it's like. Enough of that though, lets talk about good parts:-You have as much health as the enemy. One good burst and you're dead. That's awesome, that's fair and it teaches you to be damn slow and take your time like you should.- Your team are so damn important and so is communication. Your weapon won't be ideal for taking out everything at every range so you're reliant on allies and if you want to take something like a shotgun suppression isn't an option so again you rely on your team, which is great to see since so many games are too scared to make you useless in certain situations.- Enemy AI keep their eyes on their entrances. This is a basic principal of interior fighting and it's good to see that the Ai actually stick to it. If you lose one guy going through the door, you'll lose anyone who tries to follow him becuase the Ai will be aiming right at that door and has initiative, just as it should be.- No sticky cover system, if you want cover you find something solid and get behind it, no button doing ir for you. That's how I want my shooters to be.- Decent weapon customisation (Only one Shotgun which sucks though)- It's different. This game doesn't fit the "Tactical Shooter" genre that most people have created. It's a brutally realistic shooter whereby a single mistake kills you. None of this regening health, easy stealth nonesence that people associate with the genre nowerdays, just you, a gun and a building to clear. The simple hardcore nature is what defines this game.Cons:- You move slow as hell and it feels floaty, this is forgivable if you have patience but the lack of an ability to move quickly when needed is a pain.- There's only one shotgun, which sucks since they're so important in this kind of combat.- The Menus are a pain to navigate.- Allied Ai aren't smart, they'll open fire with unsuppressed weapons as soon as they spot a target.- Enemy Ai can feel rather Aimbot-like at times, and don't appear to be effected by recoil.- Certain things like placing charges can be clunky.So all in all, a damn good game that people seem to be put off from for all the wrong reasons. It's not for everyone, hell it's not for most people, but if you understand interior combat and how fast and brutal it truly is, this game is worth it. Unpolished, granted, but still a very realistic interpretation of building to building combat.

content:
Posted: October 30, 2013
												Takedown plays like an alpha of an old Old OLD Rainbow 6 game.  Multiplayer for this game is dead online, I checked in on Rainbow 6 Vegas 2 and there were people online, alot actually so play that, get that.  Reloading is baffling in this game, if you have a full magazine and hit reload, for no reason your character will throw away the full magazine inserting a new magazine.  While the game uses a controller it seems the onscreen prompts are for a keyboard, unless controllers now have a spacebar.  In this game you die in one shot, ONE SHOT, see an enemy, ok then your dead, have fun with that.In real life, walk into another room and for no reason collapse on the ground and just lie there staring at the ceiling, congratulations you know what its like to play Takedown Red Sabre, since you will walk into a room and be shotteed dead before you can do anything about it.Rating:  0/10  Value:  $0.00

number of helpful: 10 of 19 people (53%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 10, 2014
												Where to start on this game.......well for starters, the game is poorly made by Serellan, a game company in Seatle. I see they try to fix this game up, they respond on the community and they give out free DLC. If they even fixed it, it would be really hard for them to bring back a crowd.So the gameplay is just over the top bad and funny. The AI are way too hard. They will instantly shot you, WITH THEIR BACK TURNED TO YOU! The only reason I say funny is because sometimes they ragdoll and its funny. Even though I didn't buy this game on launch, Serellan probably lost a lot of fans when they removed the Text to Speech function, which people made videos of and the are quite enjoyable. Wrong move Serellan.The graphics are perfectly fine since it runs on Unreal engine, but related to the engine are the gun reload animations and much more to anything with guns. The gun reload sounds are off from the reload animation itself so the reload sound will be done before the gun is.Overall, this game is REALLY bad and needs MAJOR work. Yet somethings aren't bad like the map designs, everything else such as AI, gun reloads, loadouts need some work. Yes, if they did fix ALL these problems, the game could make a comeback but, after all the press saying the game sucks, they'd have to pull a miracle out of their asses. So therefore I rate this game 5/10 not too good, not too bad. This is why I want a neutral button. PLUS ITS 1.50 RIGHT NOW!

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 10, 2014
												You know, it's not that bad... they've splatted a lot of bugs and the game, for a tactical shooter player like me, it's enjoyable. the enemies can no longer see you through walls, they no longer have eyes in the back of their head. They are actually believable in terms of difficulty. graphics aren't excellent, but really, if the game's good(which it is now), who gives a damn.it is very much a thinking person's shooter, if you play Arma at all, you'll fit pretty well into this I think, it's quite a decent CQB shooter, without the cheesy story nonsense you get in call of duty or battlefield. in short, it's a no nonsense shut up, get on with it shooter that people who play Arma, Rainbow Six or the original Ghost Recon will enjoy quite a bit.Klaus's hot tip #1:Get to know what slicing the pie is, you'll be needing to use the movement technique quite a lot in this game!Assume behind every wall there is someone with a firearm ready to blow your head into next year!Klaus's hot tip #2:Don't spend too long in one area, I did in the biolab on floor 2 searching for enemies, and my squad got overrun, as the enemy searched for me, if someone sees or hears you, double tap them before they can bring in reinforcements to outflank and outnumber you. If possible, shoot them in the back, before they even know you are there.

content:
Posted: February 13, 2014
												I am not sure why there are so many negative reviews for this game. I'm absolutely loving the game. I am a big fan of the older Ghost Recon games and Rainbow Six Vegas 2. I think the game is tactical, methodical and realistic. One shot most of the time will take you down or your tango down. If you are into fast run and gun and churn and burn then you will not be satisfied with this game. It's methodical and requires patience and planning. To be honest, I was very hesitant on buying the game based on all the negative reviews. But, once it reached a dollar whatsoever it was hard to pass. And I'm so glad I did. I think there is a true gem here and it will only get better with more and more polishing. I know I'm going against the flow with a positive review. But, I'm really enjoying the game.

content:
Posted: February 15, 2014
												Takedown: Red Sabre, as a game, is THE worst game I have ever played. The shooting mechanics are awful, the AI are terrible and can kill you with just a pocket knife and a handful of raisins, the missions over no progression in things like weapons and player, the animations are bad, the control scheme is impractical, and (for a game that runs on the Unreal Engine 3) looks like a nintendo gameboy game.However, despite the game being broken in almost every way, it is one of THE most fun games I have ever played - especially played with friends. If this is ever on sale again, or is available for cheaper than normal price, I recommend you buy a copy for yourself and everyone on your friends list.For the game: 0/10For the experience with friends: 10/10

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 8, 2014
												Soooo bad. Quick play just dont work, half of the servers impossible to join (due to connection issues). All other servers have the very same name. Players dont want to co-operate. Most of the time some kid just shoot all teammates at the very start and there is no way to punish him, just go to another server and hope he will not follow. There are tons of ergonomic problems but most of them not just because old game engine or ♥♥♥♥♥♥ net-code optimization - it just needs so much work before it can be interesting to play. No tactical elements spoted (even so i completed all tutorial and tried like 3 different maps for about 15 rounds total) - its just who will shoot accurate first (bots are weird too, but players - due to very bad net-code latency is wasting all eforts in tactics - you see someone come past you - you shoot like 7 bullets in his nech/head - he turns, shoots 3 bullets to you and bam - you won (this guy was the last one but he never fell or somehow showed any hits from your bullets).Even CS 1.6 more realistic than that - headshots animation and net-code are way better.My thoughts - *THIS* not even cost 1 buck i payed for it in steam. Want tactics - there is Americas army 3, want realistic Battlefield - Armed Assault 2/3. This game dont compete with anything, its just too bad overal and by any measure. I can see it as realistic CS 1.6 but the game engine too old even now, what time do developers need to optimise net-code, ergonomics and gameplay - i dont know, but we will have many better shooters in all aspects - cos we already have them.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 8, 2014
												If you value your time and money, do NOT buy this game. Ever. Don't even think about it.I've been quite excited for the release of this game, so when it came out, I bought it right away. The idea of this game is everything I'm looking for in a modern First Person Shooter. But the execution... that's another story.The game feels clunky and unnatural. The very movement of your characters is like pushing a train up a hill with your bare hands. The gun mechanics and the general feeling of the firearms is like riding a bull for 8 seconds - they just don't do what you want them to do. It's like the controls are made with one reason only - to fight against you.I won't even mention the idiotic AI and the amount of bugs there were at release.So, long story short - the game was hyped by its devs way too much. They promised us things, which are completely possible and should actually be done in the gaming industry. Then they took their promises, stuffed them in a box with a padlock and gave as a disgusting abomination of a game, made for one purpose only - to milk some quick cash.
